hmUserGroup.name: hmUserGroup
hmUserGroup.contactinfo: Customer Support Postal: Hirschmann Automation and Control GmbH Stuttgarter Str. 45-51 72654 Neckartenzlingen Germany Tel: +49 7127 14 1981 Web: http://www.hicomcenter.com/ E-Mail: hicomcenter@hirschmann.com
hmUserGroup.description: The Hirschmann Private Usergroup MIB definitions for Platform devices.

MemberID.name: MemberID
MemberID.description: mac address in canonical byte order.

hmUserGroupTable.name: hmUserGroupTable
hmUserGroupTable.description: A list of user group definitions.

hmUserGroupID.name: hmUserGroupID
hmUserGroupID.description: The user group number identifying this instance.

hmUserGroupDescription.name: hmUserGroupDescription
hmUserGroupDescription.description: A textual description of the user group instance.

hmUserGroupRestricted.name: hmUserGroupRestricted
hmUserGroupRestricted.description: If set to true(1) any member of this group is restricted to ports - which have hmPortSecPermission set to group(2) and - the group is in hmPortSecAllowedGroupIDs. If set to false(2) the user may also connect to a port if permitted by other hmPortSecPermission settings, e.g. known(3) or world(4). The following access restrictions apply: UserRestr. UserGroupRestr. PortSecPermission access allowed -------------------------------------------------------------------- false false user hmPortSecAllowedUserID false false group hmPortSecAllowedGroupIDs false false known any user group member false false world yes true false/true user hmPortSecAllowedUserID true false/true group no true false/true known no true false/true world no false true user hmPortSecAllowedUserID false true group hmPortSecAllowedGroupIDs false true known no false true world no

hmUserGroupSecAction.name: hmUserGroupSecAction
hmUserGroupSecAction.description: This variable specifies the action which is taken if a user tries to connect to the given port when he is not allowed to do so. Setting the variable to none(1) disables any action. A value of trapOnly(2) generates a trap. Setting the value to portDisable(3) will send a trap, and additionally disable the port until it is re-enabled by management.

hmUserGroupMemberTable.name: hmUserGroupMemberTable
hmUserGroupMemberTable.description: A list of users which are members of a given user group.

hmUserGroupMemberGroupID.name: hmUserGroupMemberGroupID
hmUserGroupMemberGroupID.description: user group id of this member.

hmUserTable.name: hmUserTable
hmUserTable.description: List of all user group members.

hmUserRestricted.name: hmUserRestricted
hmUserRestricted.description: If set to true(1) the user may only connect to ports which have hmPortSecPermission set to user(1) and hmPortSecAllowedUserID set to hmUserID. If set to false(2) the user may also connect to a port if permitted by other hmPortSecPermission settings, e.g. group(2), known(3) or world(4). The following access restrictions apply: UserRestr. UserGroupRestr. PortSecPermission access allowed --------------------------------------------------------------------- false false user hmPortSecAllowedUserID false false group hmPortSecAllowedGroupIDs false false known any user group member false false world yes true false/true user hmPortSecAllowedUserID true false/true group no true false/true known no true false/true world no false true user hmPortSecAllowedUserID false true group hmPortSecAllowedGroupIDs false true known no false true world no

hmPortSecSlotID.name: hmPortSecSlotID
hmPortSecSlotID.description: Slot number the switch unit is plugged in.

hmPortSecPermission.name: hmPortSecPermission
hmPortSecPermission.description: This variable specifies the security level of the port. If set to user(1) only the user defined by hmPortSecAllowedUserID may connect to this port. In group(2) mode only members of the user group specified by hmPortSecAllowedGroupIDs are allowed. known(3) means that all users belonging to any user group (all known users) are accepted. Setting the value to world(4) disables the security features, i.e. any user is permitted. For backbone ports the value uplink(5) should be used. If a user does not match the allowed permission he is not able to connect to the network over this port, additionally the actions configured through hmPortSecAction are taken.

hmPortSecAllowedUserID.name: hmPortSecAllowedUserID
hmPortSecAllowedUserID.description: This variable specifies the allowed user ID if hmPortSecPermission has been set to user(1).

hmPortSecAllowedGroupIDs.name: hmPortSecAllowedGroupIDs
hmPortSecAllowedGroupIDs.description: This variable specifies the allowed user groups if hmPortSecPermission has been set to group(2). Each group is represented by a single bit. If a group does not exist the value of the bit is ignored.

hmPortSecConnectedUserID.name: hmPortSecConnectedUserID
hmPortSecConnectedUserID.description: This variable reflects the user ID of a connected user actually seen on this port. If there is no user connected the value will be 0x00:00:00:00:00:00.

hmPortSecAction.name: hmPortSecAction
hmPortSecAction.description: This variable specifies the action which is taken if a user tries to connect to the given port when he is not allowed to do so. Setting the variable to none(1) disables any action. A value of trapOnly(2) generates a trap. Setting the value to portDisable(3) will send a trap, and additionally disable the port until it is re-enabled by management. Setting the value to autoDisable(3) will send a trap, and additionally auto-disable the port for the amount of time specified per port.

hmPortSecAutoReconfigure.name: hmPortSecAutoReconfigure
hmPortSecAutoReconfigure.description: This variable controls whether the agent should re-configure the port when another user with an incompatible user group setting has been detected. The default setting, true(1), should be used if a single user is connected to the port. The value false(2) might be useful if more than one user is connected to the port (workgroup mode).

hmPortSecPortStatus.name: hmPortSecPortStatus
hmPortSecPortStatus.description: This variable shows the current status of the port with respect to port security. If the address seen on the port is allowed, the status is enabled(1), if it is not allowed, the status is disabled(2) if hmUserGroupSecurityAction is portDisable(3), or enabledWithWrongAddr(3) if hmUserGroupSecurityAction is none(1) or trapOnly(2).

hmPortSecAllowedUserIPID.name: hmPortSecAllowedUserIPID
hmPortSecAllowedUserIPID.description: This variable specifies the allowed user IP ID if hmPortSecPermission has been set to user(1).

hmPortSecDynamicLimit.name: hmPortSecDynamicLimit
hmPortSecDynamicLimit.description: This variable signifies the limit of dynamically learned allowed MAC addresses for a specific port.

hmPortSecDynamicCount.name: hmPortSecDynamicCount
hmPortSecDynamicCount.description: The current number of dynamically learned allowed MAC addresses on this port.

hmUserGroupSecurityAction.name: hmUserGroupSecurityAction
hmUserGroupSecurityAction.description: This variable specifies the action which is taken if a user tries to connect to the given port when he is not allowed to do so. Setting the variable to none(1) disables any action. A value of trapOnly(2) generates a trap. Setting the value to portDisable(3) will send a trap, and additionally disable the port until it is re-enabled by management.

hmUserGroupPortSecurityMode.name: hmUserGroupPortSecurityMode
hmUserGroupPortSecurityMode.description: This variable specifies the mode of the hmPortSecurityTable.

hmPortSecExtendedTable.name: hmPortSecExtendedTable
hmPortSecExtendedTable.description: List of extended port security entries.

hmPortSecExtendedEntry.name: hmPortSecExtendedEntry
hmPortSecExtendedEntry.description: A single extended port security entry.

hmPortSecExtSlotID.name: hmPortSecExtSlotID
hmPortSecExtSlotID.description: Slot number the switch unit is plugged in.

hmPortSecExtAction.name: hmPortSecExtAction
hmPortSecExtAction.description: This variable specifies the action which is taken if a user tries to connect to the given port when he is not allowed to do so. Setting the variable to none(1) disables any action. A value of trapOnly(2) generates a trap. Setting the value to portDisable(3) will send a trap, and additionally disable the port until it is re-enabled by management.

hmPortSecExtPortStatus.name: hmPortSecExtPortStatus
hmPortSecExtPortStatus.description: This variable shows the current status of the port with respect to port security. If the address seen on the port is allowed, the status is enabled(1), if it is not allowed, the status is disabled(2) if hmUserGroupSecurityAction is portDisable(3), or enabledWithWrongAddr(3) if hmUserGroupSecurityAction is none(1) or trapOnly(2).

hmPortSecMultipleAdressesTable.name: hmPortSecMultipleAdressesTable
hmPortSecMultipleAdressesTable.description: List of port security entries with multiple allowed addresses.

hmPortSecMultipleAdressesEntry.name: hmPortSecMultipleAdressesEntry
hmPortSecMultipleAdressesEntry.description: A single port security entry with multiple allowed addresses.

hmPortSecMASlotID.name: hmPortSecMASlotID
hmPortSecMASlotID.description: Slot number the switch unit is plugged in.

hmPortSecMAAllowedUserIDs.name: hmPortSecMAAllowedUserIDs
hmPortSecMAAllowedUserIDs.description: This variable specifies the allowed user ID if hmPortSecPermission has been set to user(1).

hmPortSecMAAllowedUserIPIDs.name: hmPortSecMAAllowedUserIPIDs
hmPortSecMAAllowedUserIPIDs.description: This variable specifies the allowed user IP ID if hmPortSecPermission has been set to user(1).

hmPortSecMAAllowedUserIDMask.name: hmPortSecMAAllowedUserIDMask
hmPortSecMAAllowedUserIDMask.description: The number of bits from left ro right, that are used from the MAC address.

hmNewUserTrap.name: hmNewUserTrap
hmNewUserTrap.description: This trap is sent if an unknown MAC address is detected on a port.

hmPortSecurityTrap.name: hmPortSecurityTrap
hmPortSecurityTrap.description: This trap is sent if a MAC address / IP address is detected on a port which is not acceptable for the current setting of hmPortSecPermission AND ...SecAction is either set to trapOnly(2) or portDisable(3).

hmPortSecConfigErrorTrap.name: hmPortSecConfigErrorTrap
hmPortSecConfigErrorTrap.description: This trap is sent when two or more users with incompatible user group settings have been detected at the port.
